page.title: 15Children in Horton.
page.content: The life-style of children in the Horton area is like that of children in many other country areas of Britain They have to get up early to catch the minibus to take them to the junior school,which starts at 9.00 am,and finishes at 3.30 pm.There are only 25 children at the school now and it is likely to close next year.If a child is over seven years old he or she will be in the primary part of the school. If the child is under seven he or she will be in the infants.There are two mixed-age classes.After school some of the boys may play football at the playing fields and some of the girls may go horse-riding.Some girls attend brownies once a week in Horton but there is no cub pack for boys.Because the population is very scattered there are not many organised activities.
